intro: Symplocos boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin boxwood, is a shrub native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with small, oval-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are white and clustered, producing small, fleshy fruits that are red when mature. Symplocos boninensis is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat.
